results.title: George Santos Invited a Guest to the State of the Union. He Said Yes.
results.abstract: Michael Weinstock, a Democrat who once ran for Mr. Santos’s district, said he wanted to raise attention to health issues of 9/11 rescue workers like himself.

media.caption: Michael Weinstock says he suffers from a neurological condition related to his time as an emergency worker.

results.title: It’s Time for a Reality Check on Eggs
results.abstract: They’re expensive, difficult to find and myths about them abound on social media. Here’s what to know.

media.copyright: Johnny Miller for The New York Times. Food Stylist: Sue Li.

results.title: Memphis Officer Texted Photo of Tyre Nichols After Beating, New Documents Show
results.abstract: The revelation came in Memphis police documents related to the firing of five officers who have been charged with murder in Mr. Nichols’s death.

media.caption: A makeshift memorial for Tyre Nichols at the corner where the police beat him, a short walk from his mother’s home.

results.abstract: First, simply acknowledge that you have it, says sex therapist Vanessa Marin. Then move on to some compliments.

results.abstract: New research shows that the UV light in nail lamps could be harmful to your health, but you may not need to cancel your next appointment.

results.title: Toxic Fumes Are Released From Burning Train That Derailed in Ohio

results.title: Time is running out to find survivors.
results.abstract: Rescues typically happen within three days of an earthquake, an expert said. The logistics of finding survivors in Turkey and Syria are daunting.

results.title: Months Before Hamlin’s Collapse, Bills’ Co-Owner Also Suffered Cardiac Arrest
results.abstract: In an essay, Jessica Pegula, a top-ranked tennis player, described the health ordeal of her mother, Kim Pegula, president of the Buffalo Bills. Hamlin, a defensive back, went into cardiac arrest at a Jan. 2 game.

media.caption: Kim Pegula at a Buffalo Bills game in 2019. Her daughter Jessica, the professional tennis player, described her mother’s recovery from cardiac arrest in an essay in The Players’ Tribune.

results.title: How Much to See a Movie at AMC? It Will Soon Depend Where You Sit.
results.abstract: By the end of 2023, the movie theater chain will offer tickets at three different price tiers, with middle seats costing the most. You’ll pay less if you like the front row.

media.caption: AMC said its new pricing system would not be applied to tickets for discounted Tuesday screenings or showings before 4 p.m.
media.copyright: Gabby Jones for The New York Times

results.title: Is Nazi Loot Amid His 6,000 Oils, Some Grenades and Napoleon’s Toothbrush?
results.abstract: The daughter of an eccentric Swiss collector has asked an independent panel to review whether items in his massive collection were stolen from Jews during World War II.

results.title: Avalanches in Alps Kill at Least 11, as Weather Hampers Rescues
results.abstract: Deaths were reported in Austria, Italy and Switzerland over the weekend. Heavy snowfall and high winds have increased the danger for skiers, officials said.

media.caption: Rescuers after an avalanche on Saturday near the town of Fieberbrunn in western Austria.

results.adx_keywords: Pop and Rock Music;Grammy Awards;Content Type: Personal Profile;Raitt, Bonnie
results.title: Bonnie Raitt Heads to the Grammys, Recognized as a Songwriter at Last
results.abstract: Long renowned as an interpreter, she has quietly built a catalog of her own. Up for song of the year on Sunday, she talked about her nominated track, “Just Like That,” and a lifetime onstage.

media.caption: Bonnie Raitt has won 10 Grammys since 1979. She’s up for four awards on Sunday, including song of the year.
media.copyright: Peter Fisher for The New York Times
